newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Gravestones smashed at Jewish cemetery in Hebron.
newsitem.headline: Gravestones smashed at Jewish cemetery in Hebron.

text.p: Vandals smashed three gravestones in a Jewish cemetery in the West Bank city of Hebron, a settler leader said on Sunday.

"Three headstones were smashed. We're going to post guards here from now on," Noam Arnon, who heads the tiny Jewish community, told Reuters. He blamed Palestinians and said settlers would meet to "decide on a response".
The headstones carried names of Jews who lived in Hebron 150 years ago, Arnon said. Witnesses said about 15 settlers and dozens of Israeli police had gathered at the cemetery.
Palestinians said "Death to the Jews" was painted in Arabic on a wall near the cemetery, signed by the Islamic militant group Hamas that opposes the Israel-PLO peace agreements.

Israeli troops withdrew from 80 percent of Hebron in January under a peace deal with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat. The cemetery is in the 20 percent still occupied by Israeli soldiers, which is also home to more than 15,000 Palestinians.
